article.title: A natural $ S_4 ×SO(10) $ model of flavour

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the diagrams in Figure 1 represent?
choices: The origin of neutrino masses through the Weinberg operator.
The ultraviolet completion of the terms giving rise to the up-type quark and Dirac neutrino Yukawa matrices.
The generation of Majorana masses for right-handed neutrinos.
The mechanism behind doublet-triplet splitting in SO(10).

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the significance of the mixed term involving φ1 and φ2 in the diagrams coupling ψ to H_d^10?
choices: It ensures a normal neutrino mass hierarchy.
It leads to a texture zero in the (1,1) element of Y_d, realizing the GST relation for the Cabibbo angle.
It explains the large lepton mixing angles.
It predicts maximal atmospheric mixing controlled by Y_22.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements about Figure 3 is true?
choices: It shows the generation of Dirac neutrino mass terms.
It depicts the diagrams responsible for the charged lepton mass matrix.
It illustrates the mechanism behind doublet-doublet splitting.
It shows the diagrams that give rise to the right-handed neutrino mass matrix.
The light effective left-handed Majorana neutrino mass matrix.
The right-handed neutrino Majorana mass matrix.
